in turn are made of DNA the entire set
of DNA that's present in a nucleus which
should be the same in all the cells in
an organism we call that the genome the

is the study of these genomes now

book of life or like the blueprint of

the first things that we need to do when

encoded in the DNA
so human DNA makes us humans other

you can see that it's very clear that
our DNA also impacts our health it can
impact our risk for heart disease or
cancer or
biddies and this is why at the genome
Institute our mission is to use genomics

about an outbreak of bacterial

few years ago this outbreak was caused
by a bacteria called Group B
streptococcus or GBS and there were
several remarkable things about this
outbreak first it was the biggest
outbreak of GPs infections ever in the
world second as part of medical
knowledge we we know what GBS does we
know that gb/s causes infections and
newborn babies or in elderly individuals
but in this Singapore outbreak it was a
different patient population it was
otherwise healthy adults and those
otherwise healthy adults were getting
infected at much higher rates than the
babies in the elderly people that we
normally expect and the only thing that
we could figure out was in common with
these healthy adults was that a lot of
them had in recent weeks eaten some raw
fish again that's also remarkable for
Group E streptococcus infections because
GPS infections standard medical teaching
says you don't get GPS infection by
eating contaminated food so this is
where genomics really played a cruel a
crucial role and trying to establish
this connection between food consumption
and GPS infections and the way we did
that was we used genomics as a kind of
fingerprinting it's very similar to how
we might find the fingerprint of a
culprit at the scene of a crime we were
able to show that the Group B
streptococcus causing infections in
human patients was the exact same as the
GPS that we isolated from raw fish
samples from the food stalls that they
ate at so genomics really helped to show
that this outbreak came from eating fish
contaminated with GBS this helped to
guide the public agencies in terms of
putting in some controls for the
handling and consumption of raw fish and
led to the cessation of the outbreak so
